channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: 'AI is making us able to develop software at the speed of light': Mistral CEO claims more than 50% of enterprise software could soon switch to AI
item.description: Traditional apps could be replaced by AI, but only if enterprises have the "right infrastructure in place" first.

item.title: India’s Sarvam wants to bring its AI models to feature phones, cars and smart glasses
item.description: The company is using edge models that take up only megabytes of space, can run on most phones with existing processors, and can work offline.

item.title: Proton VPN kills OpenVPN support on Android — here’s why that’s a good thing
item.description: Proton VPN has officially removed the OpenVPN protocol from its Android app, citing "bloat" and superior alternatives like WireGuard. Here is what you need to know.

item.title: ‘Badlands’ Almost Had Even Bigger Links to the Other ‘Predator’ and ‘Alien’ Movies
item.description: There's a sly cameo from Naru from 'Prey,' but originally it didn't stop there.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg is taking the stand as social media goes on trial
item.description: Lori Schott didn't care what it took to haul her way from her small town in Eastern Colorado to show up to a Los Angeles courtroom where Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg is set to testify Wednesday. "I don't care if I had to hire a pack mule to get me here, I was going to […]

item.title: Heron Power raises $140M to ramp production of grid-altering tech
item.description: Tesla alumni Drew Baglino raises a large round to build a giga-scale factory, this time at his own startup.

item.title: Vie numérique | Comment l’IA peut libérer votre génie musical
item.description: L’intelligence artificielle (IA) générative signe-t-elle le début de la fin de la créativité humaine dans le secteur musical ? Des sites comme Suno et Udio font craindre le pire : ils peuvent générer des chansons entières à partir d’une simple phrase descriptive. Mais l’IA peut aussi aider les amateurs de musique à devenir plus créatifs. Il suffit de trouver les bons outils....

item.title: J’ai essayé la nouvelle Dacia Spring : la voiture électrique la moins chère de France est-elle toujours trop chère pour ce qu’elle propose ?
item.description: Nouveau moteur, nouvelle batterie et toujours la voiture électrique la moins chère de France en prix de façade avec la Leapmotor T03 qui singe ses tarifs. Voici ce que propose Dacia avec le millésime 2026 de la Spring. Face à une concurrence plus polyvalente et qui se rapproche dangereusement de ses prix, la citadine franco-roumaine doit se remettre à la page pour ne pas être finalement trop chère par rapport à ce qu'elle propose. Pari réussi ? ...

item.title: Indian AI lab Sarvam’s new models are a major bet on the viability of open-source AI
item.description: The new lineup includes 30-billion and 105-billion parameter models; a text-to-speech model; a speech-to-text model; and a vision model to parse documents.

item.title: Federal court rules that OpenAI must stop using the term 'Cameo'
item.description: Cameo, the platform where celebrities sell short, personalized videos, has scored a preliminary win in a trademark lawsuit against OpenAI. A California judge has ruled that the AI company's video generation tool Sora cannot use the term 'cameo' or any variation likely to cause confusion. A temporary restraining order in the case was originally granted in November of last year. The suit was first brought in response to a feature available within the Sora app at launch called 'Cameo' that allowed users to add any likeness to videos they generated. Cameo claimed the use of the term in this settin...

item.title: Attendu de longue date, le répéteur Wi-Fi 7 d’Orange sort enfin… mais pas chez nous
item.description: Orange a lancé une nouvelle offre Wi-Fi 7 Premium combinant sa Livebox 7 au répéteur Wi-Fi 7 attendu depuis fort longtemps par bien des clients. Une bonne nouvelle, qui est réservée toutefois (pour l'instant ?) au marché espagnol.

item.title: L’offre 5G qui s’adapte à vous : payez le juste prix pour vos gigas
item.description: Prixtel lance une série spéciale sur son forfait Oxygène à 6,99 euros par mois, avec une enveloppe de données particulièrement généreuse. Ce tarif positionne l’offre comme l’une des plus compétitives pour accéder à la 5G sans engagement.

item.title: I use the 'frenemy' prompt in ChatGPT every day
item.description: By creating a simple “frenemy” trigger inside ChatGPT, you can transform it into a blunt devil’s advocate that pressure-tests your ideas before anyone else sees them

item.title: Bagged vacuums have a ton of hidden benefits — and Halo's new release is a masterclass in how to do them right
item.description: The new Halo XR looks like the perfect vacuum for allergy-sufferers.

item.title: Snap up an affordable SIM-only plan with TalkMobile
item.description: Everything you need and nothing you don’t - TalkMobile SIM-only plans

item.description: Students get 5x data at VOXI Mobile and their first month free

item.title: DG Matrix raises $60M to make data center power smarter
item.description: The startup is making solid-state transformers capable of intelligently aggregating power from a number of different sources before sending it to data center racks.

item.title: Apple is reportedly working on AI smart glasses, AirPods that can see, and its own version of those disastrous AI pins
item.description: Forget the Apple Watch – Apple is reportedly planning the next generation of wearables, and they're all packing AI cameras.

item.title: How to watch Wild Boys: Strangers in Town online from anywhere – stream true crime doc
item.description: Two brothers claim they grew up off-grid, sparking a media frenzy—but is it true? Here’s how to watch Wild Boys: Strangers in Town anywhere.

item.title: ‘An all-time high’: Number of ransomware groups exploded in 2025 as victim growth rate doubled - with Qilin dominating the landscape
item.description: Ransomware groups reached a record high in 2025, and claimed a record number of victims in the process.

item.title: How I make 6 figures on OnlyFans selling feet pics
item.description: Interview with adult creator Naomi Noel about how she makes a substantial income with foot content on OnlyFans.

item.title: Avec 65 % de remise, ce TV OLED XXL Samsung de 83 pouces s’affiche à un prix jamais vu
item.description: Vous cherchez le plus grand TV possible au meilleur prix ? Ce TV OLED de 83 pouces fera largement l’affaire, surtout au prix de 1 699 euros au lieu des 4 690 euros demandés par la marque sur sa boutique.

item.title: How to watch the T20 World Cup 2026 for free in India
item.description: We've found a sneaky way you can watch every match of the T20 World Cup 2026 for completely free in India.

item.title: Why corporate reputation matters more than ever in the age of AI and polarization
item.description: Burson CEO Corey duBrowa explains why reputation has become a $7 trillion asset, and how executives should decide when to speak up in a volatile political landscape. Corey duBrowa spent much of his career advising some of the world’s most scrutinized leaders—from Marc Benioff at Salesforce to Sundar Pichai at Google. Now, as CEO of global communications firm Burson, he’s helping executives navigate a charged marketplace shaped by AI disruption, ICE activity, and nonstop reputational risk. He explains why reputation remains one of the most powerful (and most misunderstood) assets in business, a...

item.title: Polestar will launch four new electric cars by 2028
item.description: EV manufacturer Polestar has announced plans to launch four new electric cars in the next three years.

item.title: TeamSpeak revient sur le devant de la scène à cause de Discord
item.description: Les nouvelles conditions d’utilisation de Discord conduisent des milliers de joueurs à trouver de nouvelles alternatives pour continuer d’échanger en ligne. Une situation dont profite TeamSpeak qui évoque une « augmentation incroyable » du nombre de ses nouveaux utilisateurs.

item.title: Google I/O 2026 is official: here are 5 things to expect
item.description: Google I/O 2026 is set for May, and we're likely to see new features for most of Google's operating systems.

item.title: ‘KPop Demon Hunters’ Cast on How They Slayed Their Own Demons
item.description: The singing and speaking casts just did their first joint interview for the Oscar-nominated Netflix smash.

item.title: I’m a Computing Dummy Who Tried Quantum Coding. Here’s What Happened
item.description: My first attempt at quantum coding wasn’t nearly as painful as I’d feared—and it’s probably something you could do too.

item.title: Why Olympic Choreographer Benoît Richaud Went Viral Just for Changing Jackets
item.description: Benoît Richaud is working with 16 figure skaters from 13 countries at the 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Games. WIRED spoke to him about how he roots for all of them.

item.title: The Best Smart Rings, Tested and Reviewed (2026)
item.description: A svelte smart ring can track important activity, sleep, and health metrics. Unlike some smartwatches, a ring doesn’t need to be charged every day.

item.title: This clever ‘curling bowl’ is perfect for elite snackers
item.description: Swedish designer Gustaf Westman’s new piece of functional dishware is ice rink-ready. If you’re tuning in to the Milan Cortina Olympics, you may be one of many spectators who’s suddenly invested in the sport of curling. You’re in good company: Swedish designer Gustaf Westman, best known for his chunky homeware, has become so fascinated by the event that he used it as inspiration for his latest design. ...

item.title: It's internet lockdown time, Resident Evil fans as Requiem spoilers are reportedly out there — and I'm avoiding them too
item.description: Resident Evil Requiem is fast approaching, and spoilers for the game are reportedly available online, so gamers might want to shore up their defences.

item.title: Cette petite nouveauté d’iOS 26.4 qui pourrait sauver des vies en France
item.description: Avec iOS 26.4, Apple met à jour la façon dont sont gérés les numéros d'urgence en France.

item.title: T-Mobile 5G Home Internet Puts Fastest In Your Connection and Cash In Your Pocket
item.description: New T-Mobile subscribers can get one month of the fastest 5G Home Internet, easy installation, and up to $300 back.

item.title: 'That is extremely stupid design' — The Witcher story lead blasts epilogue he mostly created
item.description: A The Witcher developer has spoken about the game in a new playthrough on YouTube.

item.title: Get your 1st month of Proton Drive for just $1 — score 200GB of cloud storage for a low price
item.description: As of Feb. 18, Proton Drive is offering a deal of $1 for the first month of its Drive Plus 200 GB monthly plan, or 40% off the Drive Plus 200 GB annual plan.

item.title: Gratuitement, Samsung double le stockage de ses futurs Galaxy S26
item.description: C'est un fait, les Galaxy S26 seront plus chers cette année. Pour autant, Samsung nous laisse une chance de limiter la casse avec une offre de lancement intéressante.

item.title: Are Mushroom Supplements Worth Taking? (2026)
item.description: We spoke with registered dietitians and tested popular formulas to break down the research behind functional fungi.

item.title: Dell XPS 14 Review (2026): This Laptop Marks an Incredible Comeback
item.description: Sporting a refined design and incredible integrated GPU performance, the Dell XPS 14 is the return to form I hoped it would be.

item.title: Bouygues brade cette box fibre avec TV à moins de 20 € avant de faire définitivement disparaître cette offre
item.description: Bouygues Telecom sacrifie son ancienne Bbox avec une réduction inédite. L'offre « Fin de série » tombe à 19,99 euros par mois pendant un an, contre 24,99 euros habituellement.

item.title: Get the Razer Orochi V2 wireless gaming mouse for its lowest-ever price at Amazon — save $40
item.description: Razer Orochi V2 wireless gaming mouse drops to $29.99 on Amazon — its lowest price ever, with ultra-light design and long battery life.

item.title: Tesla stops using 'Autopilot' to promote its EVs in California
item.description: Tesla has stopped using the term “Autopilot” to sell its cars in California, thereby avoiding a 30-day sales and manufacturing ban in the state. If you’ll recall, a California administrative law judge ruled in December that the automaker misled consumers by using the terms “Autopilot” and “Full Self-Driving.” The judge recommended the suspension, but the California DMV gave Tesla 60 days to remove any untrue and misleading language in its marketing materials. In its announcement, the DMV said Tesla has taken corrective action and has stopped using Autopilot for marketing. Prior to that, the au...

item.title: VMware customers are still trying to ditch its software, two years after Broadcom acquisition
item.description: VMware customers are still worried about price rises more than two years after its Broadcom acquisition.

item.title: Majority's budget audio sub-brand just unveiled blindingly cheap speakers, MP3 players and soundbars — and I'm gonna need to hear them
item.description: Active bookshelf speakers for just £70 (which is around $95 or AU$134)? They've got to be worth a test drive…

item.title: France Identité : prendre l’avion avec son smartphone, c’est enfin pour cet été
item.description: L’application France Identité franchit une nouvelle étape pratique. Dès l’été 2026, elle permettra officiellement de justifier son identité lors de l’embarquement dans les aéroports français. Une simplification bienvenue pour les vols domestiques et certaines liaisons européennes.
